WorkItem.Description:
Even if the grid doesn't display any scrollbar, it handles the mouse wheel events and stop their propagation. Here's an example:
Put lots of content inside a scrollviewer, including a grid. The grid itself should not have scrollbars.
Now, everywhere you can use your mouse wheel to scroll up and down the scrollviewer; but not on the datagrid!
Â 
Correct behaviour should be: if the gridview has scrollbars, it handles the mouse wheel. Otherwise, it should let it propagate up in the control hierarchy.

Comments.Message: This is an issue with the WPF ScrollViewer, which marks all mouse wheel messages as handled. We are tracking this issue in our internal database.

I agree. In read only data grid mouse wheel scrolling is not working.  It looks like the data grid was designed for edit of data. Why do we have to reset so many properties to make Data Grid read only and enable sorting and scrolling?
